title.content: How much money should Dan give back to his little sister?

clue1.content: But this week Dan made the worst deal ever.

clue2.content: This week Dan told his sister that new money was better than crumpled old money. He swapped his new £20 note for her old £50 note.

clue3.content: On the third week, Dan tried something different. He told Emma that green notes were better than pale orange notes. So she gave him a £10 note for his £5 note!

clue4.content: The second week, Dan told Emma that cute little coins were better than big heavy coins. So he traded his £1 coin for her £2 coin.

clue5.content: His friends said: "Dan, you pay Emma back or we'll tell your parents about your mean little deals!"

clue6.content: he first week, Dan swapped his 2 50p pieces for her £2 coin. He told her that it was a good deal because 2 is more than 1!

clue7.content: Emma doesn't know much about money, so he has been making deals with her every week for a month.

clue8.content: His friends asked him where he got all the cash. "From Emma, my silly little sister." Dan bragged.

clue9.content: Dan told his friends to order the 2 biggest ice-cream cones on the menu, and he would pay for them.

clue10.content: In the local sweet shop Dan was bragging to his friends.
